resources.string: Have you received a verification code?
We have sent you an SMS with a code to
Please complete the following information before you can create a virtual visit.
Fields marked with an * are required.
Please provide all the fields marked with an (*).
I agree to Intellicare Legal Terms
Enter Last Name of Primary Member:
System failed to verify your membership. Your information has been routed to one of our care coordinators. They are checking with your medical group and will get in touch with you shortly.
If experiencing a medical emergency, you should immediately seek emergency care by calling 911
Please check your message. We sent a one-time password to mobile no:
Note: Repeat patients need to use their registered mobile phone number.

Your wait time is shown below. The provider will send a notification when she/he is ready to see you. The button below will change to "Engage". You will then have 3 minutes to start a consult. If you miss the window, the provider will see the next patient in the queue and notify you again when she/he is ready to see you.


You may cancel this visit any time and come back later.


When you engage with the provider, you have the option of just doing an audio-only visit. You will see the provider, but you need to opt-in for the provider to see you.


If a medication is needed, the provider will send that to your chosen pharmacy. You can update your pharmacy using "Manage Information" below or let the provider know your closest pharmacy.

Capture a picture of your insurance card.

  &bull Place card on a desk on a dark-colored surface that\'s

    not reflective and is well lit

  &bull Position camera directly over the card (not angled)

  &bull Fit all four corners inside the guides

Capture a picture of your current prescribed medications.

  &bull Position camera directly over the medication label

  &bull For multiple medications, place them together when

    capturing a picture or individually capture the image

    of each medication

  &bull Fit all four corners inside the guides

Capture a picture of an official photo ID.

  &bull Driver\'s license or a government-issued ID

  &bull Students can use a school ID

  &bull For toddlers and infants, capture a picture

    of their face or a photograph

  &bull Fit all four corners inside the guides
Before creating a visit, please ensure your insurance, current medications and allergy information are accurate.
The current wait time for a provider is approximately xx minutes.
Service is available from 6 AM to 10 PM pacific time.
The information below will help the provider to address your illness. If you do not have access to a thermometer or a BP meter, leave those fields information blank.
You are getting call from IntelliCare health provider. Pick up now to continue to the consultation
The provider has put the call on hold as per your request. Please click the button below once you are ready to resume the call
The session is on hold. The provider can resume the session only when the slider below is set to "I'm here"

Welcome to Intellicare Health app – a virtual care service provided by your Medical Group. This added service allows you to access a team of providers that you consult with via an audio or video session for all urgent care, questions regarding your health, or prescription refill. This service comes at no additional cost to you. Health professionals will be at your service from 6:00 a.m. at 10 p.m., Pacific time, every day of the week except Wednesdays.
OTP has been successfully re-sent to\n
Do you want to cancel the consultation?
Do you want to exit the application?
Do you want to exit the video consultation?

About Intellicare Service and Eligibility 

Patients can now get extended access to care at the comfort of their home, office, or wherever you are through the Intellicare app. Your medical group offers this service for its members' convenience at no additional cost to the patient. The fact that you have downloaded this app, you probably were directed to do so via text message or email, or by your primary doctor's office. If your medical group has not offered this service, check with the primary care physician or their office to sign up for the Intellicare service. Alternatively, have an Intellicare staff check for your eligibility. Click here to provide us the name of your group. 

When would you use this virtual service? 
If you think you're experiencing a medical emergency or a bodily injury, you should immediately seek emergency care by calling 911. Additionally, if you need to see your doctor for specific issues, you should contact your doctor's officeFor most other non-critical illnesses (such as fever, cold, cough, rash, depression, and bodily aches), medication refill, therapeutic sessions, or medical questions, you can use this service. 

My doctor's offices asked me to use this service. How do I get started? 
If using the app for the first time, log in as directed. You must use your primary mobile number when logging in. This number is used for authentication and verified with a one-time password every time you log in. To ensure the provider has crucial information about the patient, you will need to enrol. Have your insurance card, a photo ID, and current medications. The app will walk you through a short but quick registration process. You can also reach out to our care coordinators to help you through this process. Once you have completed registration, the care coordinator will verify your insurance/medical group for eligibility. 

What do I need to do to get care after I have registered? 
Once the registration is complete, you can initiate a visit from the dashboard screen. If you are a repeat patient, you need to log in by using your name, DOB and registered phone number. After the One Time Password is verified, the app will take you right into the dashboard that allows you to initiate a visit with the medical provider. 

What devices can I use to get my care? 
Instead of a password, Intellicare validates a patient based sending a one-time passcode to their registered mobile phone. You can use your registered smart-phone (iPhone or Android phone) to get your virtual care. Alternatively, you may also download the Intellicare Health app on an iPad or tablet device and log in from that device but enter your registered mobile phone no to receive your one-time passcode. 

Can my family use the Intellicare virtual care service? 
If the insurance covers members' dependents, they are eligible to receive virtual care. You will need to independently register each of the dependents using the Intellicare app because the provider will maintain a separate medical history for individual patients. If the dependent is an adult and has their mobile phone, they may use their mobile number when registering and continue to use that number for subsequent visits. Dependents below the age of 18 or those that do not have separate mobile can use the mobile number of the insured's primary member. 

Is this a 24x7 service? 
Currently, providers will see you only from 6 AM to 10 PM all days of the week except Wednesdays. If you place a call outside these hours, your visit is in their queue, and the provider will call you when they are ready to see you. 

What is the wait time to see a provider? 
Intellicare intends to patients with minimum wait time. When a patient initiates a visit, they are in the waiting room, that and an approximate wait time is displayed. When a provider is ready to see the patient, the provider sends a 3-minute notification to the app. The patient will have 3 minutes to initiate the call. Failure to start within the time allocated will result in the provider seeing the next patient. A cycle of notification will repeat. The provider might cancel the visit after repeated tries to engage with the patient. The patient also can withdraw the visit at any time when in the waiting room. 

Do I have to turn on the video when talking to the provider? 
Once connected to the provider, you will see the provider. The provider will hear you but not see you. You have the option of enabling the video, or the provider may ask you to turn on the video for insurance ID verification or for specific treatment purposes.

Your approximate wait time is shown below. The provider will send a notification when she/he is ready to see you and the button below will change to “START”. You will then have 3 minutes to start a consult. If you miss the window, the provider will see the next patient in the queue and notify you again when she/he is ready to see you. 

You may cancel this visit any time and come back later. 

When you engage with the provider, you have the option of just doing an audio-only visit. You will see the provider, but you need to opt-in for the provider to see you. 

If a medication is needed, the provider will send that to your chosen pharmacy. You can update your pharmacy using “Manage Personal Information” below or let the provider know your closest pharmacy.

Capture a picture of your insurance card.
• Place card on a desk on a dark-colored surface that’s not reflective and is well lit 
• Position camera directly over the card (not angled)
• Fit all four corners inside the guides

Capture a picture of your current prescribed medications.
• Position camera directly over the medication label
• For multiple medications, place them together when capturing a picture or individually capture the image of each medication
• Fit all four corners inside the guides

Capture a picture of an official photo ID.
• Driver's license or a government-issued ID
• Students can use a school ID
• For toddlers and infants, capture a picture of their face or a photograph
